data.title: Corum Group
data.text:
Bharti Telesoft acquires Jataayu Software

Bharti Telesoft, a provider of integrated VAS solutions for mobile operators, acquired , a pioneer of WAP and mobile handset applications. Jataayu has created strong technology focused products, acquired a wide customer base and has established a strong identity in the mobile VAS space over the last seven years. For Bharti Telesoft, the acquisition is a part of the company's growth strategy, which is focused on strengthening its service offerings in new and existing markets. With the acquisition, Bharti Telesoft reinforces its position as a leader in the integrated VAS space. Jataayu's wholly owned subsidiary in the USA and offices in the UK, Singapore, Taiwan and South Korea will be added to Bharti Telesoft's existing operations across Africa, the Middle East and AsiaPac regions.

Announcement Date: December 19, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

BSQUARE acquires Adobe Flash Technology Business from NEC Corporation of America

BSQUARE has acquired NEC Corporation of Americas Adobe Flash Technology Consulting and Distribution business. As a result of the transaction, BSQUARE is now a worldwide authorized distributor of Adobe Flash Lite software, which supports Adobe Flash Player functionality for mobile and embedded devices. A license is required for any mobile or embedded device that utilizes Flash Lite software. BSQUARE will license Flash Lite to OEMs building mobile and embedded devices and will also deliver Flash Lite porting, performance-optimization, testing and verification services. In addition, BSQUARE plans to feature Flash Lite on its DevKit hardware development platforms.

Announcement Date: December 19, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Qualcomm acquires SoftMax

Qualcomm has acquired SoftMax Inc., a market leader in noise reduction for mobile devices. SoftMax brings leading-edge, multi-microphone noise suppression and echo cancellation expertise to Qualcomm, broadening the audio and voice capabilities of the Company's product portfolio for integration into devices such as mobile handsets, Bluetooth headsets, VoIP phones and notebook PCs. SoftMax's leading-edge voice algorithms for signal separation, echo cancellation and signal processing have enabled some of the latest wireless devices on the market to separate a speaker's voice from various background noises. With the acquisition of SoftMax, Qualcomms solutions will deliver advanced voice capabilities for handsets, Bluetooth headsets and other consumer devices.

Announcement Date: December 17, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Atheros Communications to acquire u-Nav Microelectronics

Atheros Communications Inc., a developer of advanced wireless solutions, has agreed to acquire u-Nav Microelectronics, a fabless semiconductor company specializing in global positioning system (GPS) chipsets and software that enable mobile location-based products and services. U-Navs product portfolio includes single-die solutions, several baseband chips and RFICs, and complete GPS system software solutions providing signal acquisition, tracking, data extraction and GPS navigation. The acquisition of u-Nav immediately expands Atheros growing product portfolio in mobile wireless communications which also includes mobile wireless LAN (WLAN), Bluetooth and PHS.

Announcement Date: December 13, 2007

Deal Value: $54 million (cash and stock)

Nokia acquires Avvenu

Nokia will acquire Avvenu, provider of Internet services which allow anyone to use their mobile devices to securely access, use and share personal computer files, even if their host computer is turned off. By acquiring Avvenu, Nokia plans to further enhance its portfolio of solutions for mobile operators, as well as deliver a secure file access and share service direct to mobile workers. Nokia believes that anytime access to PC content is a missing ingredient to mobile productivity. Smartphone adoption is growing faster than previously estimated and surveys confirm that many people are using mobile devices to view, process, and edit content. Easy access to existing PC content will fuel mobile computing convenience and productivity. With the integration of Avvenu's technology, Nokia will further extend its business mobility solutions beyond email to add collaboration tools that enable greater everyday productivity through access to a user's own content anytime, anywhere, from any connected device.

Announcement Date: December 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

NexTone merges with Reef Point

In a move that creates a fully integrated fixed-mobile connectivity platform, NexTone Communications, Inc., the software-centric session border controller and session management provider and Reef Point Systems, Inc., the mobile access universal convergence gateway provider, will merge to form NextPoint Networks, Inc. The combined company will bring mobile and fixed-network operators around the world the ability to quickly, securely and profitably deliver voice, data and video services over all IP networks. The new companys growth will be supported by a $20 million round of funding led by One Equity Partners, the private equity arm of JP Morgan Chase, and joined by American Capital, Core Capital Partners, Jerusalem Venture Partners, Safeguard Scientifics, and Summerhill Venture Partners.

Announcement Date: December 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Qualcomm to acquire Firethorn

Qualcomm Incorporated is acquiring Firethorn Holdings, LLC, an industry-leading mobile banking enabler. Firethorn's expertise in financial services and telecom, commercially deployed platform and early market leadership in mobile banking complement Qualcomm's expertise in enabling wireless services across networks and devices. The addition of Firethorn's expertise in the financial industry and key relationships with wireless operators, financial institutions and payment processors supports Qualcomm's broader strategy to enable end-to-end wireless services that enhance the mobile experience and to deliver compelling applications that drive increased consumer adoption of new mobile data services.

Announcement Date: November 14, 2007

Deal Value: $210 million (cash)

Microsoft to acquire Musiwave

Microsoft is acquiring Musiwave SA (France), an Openwave company and a leading provider of mobile music entertainment services to operators and media companies. Microsoft and Musiwave share the same philosophy in working with hardware and mobile operator partners to deliver great experiences for mobile device users. Bringing Musiwave on board would provide an opportunity for Microsoft to explore new areas in the mobile space previously untapped, and to showcase the power of software plus services. The acquisition would bring Musiwave's relationships with music labels, device makers and mobile operators that deliver digital entertainment to consumers, together with Microsoft's Connected Entertainment technologies and services, including Windows Mobile, Zune, MSN and Windows Live.

Announcement Date: November 12, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Synchronica acquires GoodServer

Synchronica plc (UK), an international vendor of mobile synchronization and device management software, has acquired the assets of the U.S. mobile email specialist GoodServer. GoodServer's technology is a key component of Synchronica's Mobile Gateway and supports the mobile email products of a number of players in the telecommunications market. With a huge addressable audience, the market for push email is set to increase drastically as mobile email and personal information management (PIM) services cross over into the mainstream. Open industry standards have cleared the way for accessing PIM and email on mass-market phones, particularly in emerging markets.

Announcement Date: November 5, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

go2 and 80108 Media merge

go2, a provider of mobile search and directory services, and 80108 Media, a pioneer in original local mobile content, are merging to form go2 Media, a company focused on the growing user demand for more localized, personalized mobile content. The merger combines a leader in mobile search and directory services with longstanding carrier and advertiser relationships and a pioneer in local mobile media with an existing network of local content correspondents. go2 Media will further enable carriers to deliver a more relevant content experience to a broader base of subscribers that can be reached by advertisers on both a broad and targeted basis.

Announcement Date: October 24, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Cisco to Buy Navini

Cisco Systems Inc. is acquiring privately held Navini Networks Inc., extending the networking equipment maker's acquisition streak and providing the latest validation for the WiMax wireless network technology. Navini makes base stations, modems and technologies for beaming and receiving radio signals using WiMax technology. Navini's technology will help Cisco build high-speed Internet networks deep in emerging markets where traditional Internet infrastructure doesn't exist or is spotty. Unlike Wi-Fi networks, which are found in homes and cafes and typically have a range of just a few hundred yards, WiMax networks can extend for miles and blanket entire cities with broadband connectivity. Navini's products will complement the Wi-Fi wireless technology already embedded in Cisco's products.

Announcement Date: October 23, 2007

Deal Value: $330 million (cash and options)

Honeywell to acquire Hand Held Products Inc.

Honeywell is acquiring Hand Held Products Inc., a privately held Automatic Identification and Data Collection company. Hand Held Products manufactures a range of data collection and communication products designed for mobile, onsite, and transaction processing in retail, healthcare, utilities, transportation, logistics and industry. Hand Held will become a part of Honeywell's Security Group within the Automation and Control Solutions business. Honeywell believes Hand Held's growth potential and strong positions in key vertical markets complement its existing wireless solutions and the culture are a great fit.

Announcement Date: October 15, 2007

Deal Value: $290 million (cash)

Seller Revenue: $285 million (2006)

ISCO International and Clarity Communications to merge

ISCO International, Inc., a provider of radio-frequency management and interference-control systems for the wireless telecommunications industry, announced a merger with Clarity Communication Systems, Inc., a provider of value-added applications for mobile networks and devices such as Intouch push-to-talk, Whereabouts location-based services and Where2Talk solution, a combined PTT and LBS solution provided to major OEMs and wireless operators globally. The companies strategic intent is to try to accelerate the development of complete digital adaptive interference management ('AIM') platform and begin to address the OEM channels in both infrastructure and handsets.

Announcement Date: October 15, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Enfora acquires TeleM2M

Enfora announced today it has acquired the assets and employees of privately held Intellimatics (DBA TeleM2M). TeleM2M provides middleware that easily integrates with enterprise software and allows the management of wireless devices and communication sessions. The TeleM2M middleware solution reduces development time for wireless applications by providing a consistent interface that enables seamless integration of wireless devices with existing enterprise software. The TeleM2M middleware will complement and enhance Enforas existing offerings for asset management, remote monitoring and control, and location-based services.

Announcement Date: October 11, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

SendMe acquires mbuzzy

SendMe, a mobile media company, has acquired mbuzzy, the industry's first off-portal mobile community in the U.S. market. mbuzzy provides both an online and mobile environment to let people interact, share user-generated content and stay connected while on-the-go. The mbuzzy community is home to more than half a million mobile users who have downloaded over 15 million pieces of social media to their mobile phones. With mbuzzy.com SendMe adds community and social media capabilities to its portfolio of interconnected brands, which also includes SendMeMobile.com and SoLow.com. The acquisition further solidifies SendMe's position in mobile content, entertainment, and now community.

Announcement Date: October 10, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Google buys Jaiku

Google has acquired Finland startup Jaiku, which makes a mobile phone application people can use to send short messages. Founded last year in Helsinki, Jaiku specializes in mobile phone software that makes it easier to share updates about their whereabouts and thoughts. The concept, known as "microblogging," is also being promoted by another startup, San Francisco-based Twitter. Google believes Jaiku's technology can help develop new ways to use mobile devices. It hasn't made a formal announcement, but Google reportedly is working on a new operating platform for mobile devices to make it easier for people to access Google products when they're away from their personal computers.

Announcement Date: October 9, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Silver Lake Sumeru acquires Mobile Messenger

Private equity group, Silver Lake Sumeru has acquired Mobile Messenger, a global provider of technology and services for mobile content management and distribution. Mobile Messenger's technology and services enable its customers to leverage mobile media distribution channels seamlessly by providing turnkey solutions that facilitate all aspects of sales and marketing over mobile networks. Mobile Messenger believes Silver Lake Sumeru's technology focus and operational expertise make them an ideal partner to help execute the next steps toward its global growth strategy. Silver Lake Sumeru feels Mobile Messenger's record of profitability and world-class provision of end-to-end solutions to its clients gives the company a competitive edge in this emerging technology sector and solidly positions the company for continued growth.

Announcement Date: October 8, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Air2Web and MindMatics to merge

Air2Web, Inc. and MindMatics AG (Germany) today announced the two companies have agreed to merge. The transaction firmly establishes the combined organization in the global pure-play mobile marketing arena. The combined entity is the first vendor able to deliver a full range of mobile marketing capabilities to enterprises, brands, agencies and carriers. The new company presents significant advantages for clients looking to consolidate marketing initiatives across verticals, programs and continents, enabling a fundamental change in the way organizations can integrate mobile strategies into their overall marketing programs.

Announcement Date: October 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Rivermine and BBR Wireless Management merge

Rivermine, provider of telecom expense management (TEM) solutions, announced a merger with BBR Wireless Management, a wireless management innovator. The market front-runners merged to meet ongoing, high demand for unified wireline and wireless expense management solutions from global customers and channel partners. Rivermine stands among very few pure play TEM companies that are responding to the demand for a unified wireline and wireless expense management vision. The combined company will be able to satisfy the increased demand for unified wireless and wireline solutions. Coming together under the Rivermine name, the combined entity will have an installed base of over 225 companies.

Announcement Date: October 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Single Touch Interactive acquires Soapbox Mobile

Single Touch Interactive, a pioneer and innovator in Abbreviated Dialing Codes (ADCs), acquired Soapbox Mobile, a mobile marketing agency and technology platform provider. Abbreviated Dialing Codes enable callers to directly access information on products and services via any mobile phone and download content and audio products through voice services. This acquisition provides Single Touch Interactive with a proven campaign management platform and strengthens the already powerful ADC platform by adding a carrier-grade campaign management and analytics platform that allows clients customized direct visibility into every aspect of their advertising and marketing campaigns.

Announcement Date: October 2, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Nokia to buy Navteq

Nokia Corp. (Finland) is buying U.S. navigation software maker Navteq Corp. In one of its largest takeovers ever, but its shares fell as analysts dubbed the deal "expensive." The acquisition would give the world's top cell phone maker  which is looking for new revenue sources as the cell phone industry matures  a stronghold in the navigation business, one of the fastest growing segments in the technology industry. Navteq has been seen as a takeover target since TomTom, the world's top maker of car navigation devices, offered 1.8 billion euros ($2.55 billion) in July for Navteq's only big rival, Tele Atlas. Nokia already bought into the navigation industry last year when it acquired German software firm Gate5, which uses map data from providers like Tele Atlas and Navteq.

Announcement Date: October 1, 2007

Deal Value: $8.1 billion (cash)

Seller Revenue: $685.60 (ttm)

Google acquires Zingku

In a move to bolster its presence in the mobile phone sector, Google has announced that it acquired mobile social networking firm Zingku, which is essentially targeted toward teenagers and the youth. Zingku is a service designed to make it easier to share content with friends using a mobile phone and the Zingku website. The fact that Zingku is a mobile phone service lends further weight to reports that Google plans to bolster its presence in the mobile phone sector, potentially with the release of its own handset. Stymied for the time being in its effort to acquire DoubleClick for $3.1 billion, Google is having more success buying up small companies.

Announcement Date: October 1, 2007
